FuncDef:
The ospf timer retransmit command sets the interval at which LSAs are retransmitted on an interface.
The undo ospf timer retransmit command restores the default value.
By default, the interval is 5 seconds.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies an interval at which LSAs are retransmitted on an interface.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 3600, in seconds.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
After transmitting an LSA to its neighbor, a device waits for an ACK packet from the neighbor. If no ACK packet is received from the neighbor after the LSA retransmission interval expires, this LSA is retransmitted.
Do not set too short LSA retransmission intervals between adjacent routers to prevent unnecessary retransmission.
Precautions
The command cannot be run on a null interface.
